block.p: STREAKS
Albert Pujols of the Cardinals has four straight 40-homer seasons.
Adam Dunn of the Reds and David Ortiz of the Red Sox have three straight 40-homer seasons.

Miguel Tejada of the Orioles has played in 1,080 consecutive games, seventh most in history. If he plays in all 162 games this season, he'll finish at 1,242, which would move him up to fourth behind Cal Ripken Jr. (2,632), Lou Gehrig (2,130) and Everett Scott (1,307).
Four pitchers have at least 15 victories each of the past three seasons: Roy Oswalt (Astros), Chris Carpenter (Cardinals), Randy Johnson (Diamondbacks) and Johan Santana (Twins).
